page.title: 01BISHOPSTONE AND HINTON DOWNS
page.content: BISHOPSTONE AND HINTON DOWNS. THE AREA CONSISTS MAINLY OF FARMLAND.IT OCCUPIES A PORTION OF THE MARLBOROUGH DOWNS SOUTH OF BISHOPSTONE AND SEVEN MILES EAST OF SWINDON, WILTSHIRE,REPUTED TO BE THE FASTEST GROWING TOWN IN EUROPE. THE BISHOPSTONE AND HINTON DOWNS REMAIN ALMOST UNTOUCHED BY MODERN DEVELOPMENT. THE ONLY SIGN OF IT IS AT SU 240.800 WHERE THE M.4. MOTORWAY PASSES WITHIN METRES OF THE BOUNDARY.THERE ARE ABOUT TWELVE HOUSES IN THE AREA,FOUR OF WHICH ARE SCATTERED WHILST THE OTHERS CLUSTER AROUND A ONCE PROSPEROUS, BUT AT PRESENT DEFUNCT, RACING STABLES.UNDULATING GRASS AND ARABLE LAND BETWEEN 500 AND 800 FEET ABOVE SEA LEVEL,TRAVERSED BY THE ANCIENT RIDGEWAY AND OTHER FOOT AND BRIDLE PATHS,MAKE THIS AREA VERY ATTRACTIVE.
